name: Entry
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry
description:
Entry

An individual entry in a log.

Each log entry is composed of metadata and a payload. The metadata includes standard information used by Stackdriver Logging, such as when the entry was created and where it came from. The payload is the event record. Traditionally this is a message string, but in Stackdriver Logging it can also be a JSON or protocol buffer object. A single log can have entries with different payload types.

A log is a named collection of entries. Logs can be produced by Google Cloud Platform services, by third-party services, or by your applications. For example, the log compute.googleapis.com/activity_log is produced by Google Compute Engine. Logs are simply referenced by name in google-cloud. There is no Log type in google-cloud or Log resource in the Stackdriver Logging API.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

entry = logging.entry payload: "Job started.", log_name: "my_app_log"
entry.resource.type = "gae_app"
entry.resource.labels[:module_id] = "1"
entry.resource.labels[:version_id] = "20150925t173233"

logging.write_entries entry

examples.caption: Provide a hash to write a JSON payload to the log:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

payload = { "stats" => { "a" => 8, "b" => 12.5} }
entry = logging.entry payload: payload, log_name: "my_app_log"
entry.resource.type = "gae_app"
entry.resource.labels[:module_id] = "1"
entry.resource.labels[:version_id] = "20150925t173233"

logging.write_entries entry

methods.name: initialize
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#initialize
methods.description: Create a new Entry instance. The #resource attribute is pre-populated with a new Google::Cloud::Logging::Resource instance. See also Google::Cloud::Logging::Project#entry.

methods.name: log_name
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#log_name
methods.description:
The resource name of the log to which this log entry belongs. The format of the name is projects/<project-id>/logs/<log-id>. e.g. projects/my-projectid/logs/my_app_log and projects/1234567890/logs/library.googleapis.com%2Fbook_log

The log ID part of resource name must be less than 512 characters long and can only include the following characters: upper and lower case alphanumeric characters: [A-Za-z0-9]; and punctuation characters: forward-slash (/), underscore (_), hyphen (-), and period (.). Forward-slash (/) characters in the log ID must be URL-encoded.

methods.name: log_name=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#log_name=
methods.description:
The resource name of the log to which this log entry belongs. The format of the name is projects/<project-id>/logs/<log-id>. e.g. projects/my-projectid/logs/my_app_log and projects/1234567890/logs/library.googleapis.com%2Fbook_log

The log ID part of resource name must be less than 512 characters long and can only include the following characters: upper and lower case alphanumeric characters: [A-Za-z0-9]; and punctuation characters: forward-slash (/), underscore (_), hyphen (-), and period (.). Forward-slash (/) characters in the log ID must be URL-encoded.

methods.name: resource
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#resource
methods.description: The monitored resource associated with this log entry. Example: a log entry that reports a database error would be associated with the monitored resource designating the particular database that reported the error.

methods.name: resource=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#resource=
methods.description: The monitored resource associated with this log entry. Example: a log entry that reports a database error would be associated with the monitored resource designating the particular database that reported the error.

methods.name: timestamp
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#timestamp
methods.description: The time the event described by the log entry occurred. If omitted, Stackdriver Logging will use the time the log entry is written.

methods.name: timestamp=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#timestamp=
methods.description: The time the event described by the log entry occurred. If omitted, Stackdriver Logging will use the time the log entry is written.

methods.name: severity
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#severity
methods.description: The severity level of the log entry. The default value is :DEFAULT.

methods.name: severity=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#severity=
methods.description: The severity level of the log entry. The default value is :DEFAULT.

methods.name: default?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#default?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is :DEFAULT.

methods.name: default!
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#default!
methods.description: Sets the severity level to :DEFAULT.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

entry = logging.entry
entry.severity = :DEBUG
entry.default!
entry.default? #=> true
entry.severity #=> :DEFAULT

methods.name: debug?
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#debug?
methods.description: Returns true if the severity level is :DEBUG.

methods.name: debug!
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#debug!
methods.description: Sets the severity level to :DEBUG.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/logging"

logging = Google::Cloud::Logging.new

entry = logging.entry
entry.severity #=> :DEFAULT
entry.debug!
entry.debug? #=> true
entry.severity #=> :DEBUG

methods.name: insert_id
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#insert_id
methods.description: A unique ID for the log entry. If you provide this field, the logging service considers other log entries in the same log with the same ID as duplicates which can be removed. If omitted, Stackdriver Logging will generate a unique ID for this log entry.

methods.name: insert_id=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#insert_id=
methods.description: A unique ID for the log entry. If you provide this field, the logging service considers other log entries in the same log with the same ID as duplicates which can be removed. If omitted, Stackdriver Logging will generate a unique ID for this log entry.

methods.name: labels
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#labels
methods.description: A set of user-defined data that provides additional information about the log entry.

methods.name: labels=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#labels=
methods.description: A set of user-defined data that provides additional information about the log entry.

methods.name: payload
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#payload
methods.description: The log entry payload, represented as either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

methods.name: payload=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#payload=
methods.description: The log entry payload, represented as either a string, a hash (JSON), or a hash (protocol buffer).

methods.name: http_request
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#http_request
methods.description: Information about the HTTP request associated with this log entry, if applicable.

methods.name: operation
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#operation
methods.description: Information about an operation associated with the log entry, if applicable.

methods.name: trace
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#trace
methods.description: Resource name of the trace associated with the log entry, if any. If it contains a relative resource name, the name is assumed to be relative to //tracing.googleapis.com. Example: projects/my-projectid/traces/06796866738c859f2f19b7cfb3214824 Optional.

methods.name: trace=
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#trace=
methods.description: Resource name of the trace associated with the log entry, if any. If it contains a relative resource name, the name is assumed to be relative to //tracing.googleapis.com. Example: projects/my-projectid/traces/06796866738c859f2f19b7cfb3214824 Optional.

methods.name: source_location
title: Google
Cloud
Logging
Entry#source_location
methods.description: Source code location information associated with the log entry, if any.
